name: Eden Lost
description: Terraforming expands the possibilities of the cosmos. Starfleet has discovered a Class D planet ripe for terraforming. But not everyone is open to the procedure...
rules:
-- In a Specialist Event, you will select crew to engage in Specialist Missions.
-- Only a single crew with corresponding skills can be assigned to a Specialist Mission. After the mission is completed, that crew will be disabled from doing Specialist Missions for some period of time.
-- Specialist Missions take time to complete. The higher selected crew skills are the less time it will take them to complete a mission.
-- Only the highest skill of a crew is considered when calculating time to complete a mission.
-- Using crew with matching Specialist Mission bonus traits will significantly decrease time needed to complete a mission.
-- Each time a Specialist Mission is completed, some progress is also gained on the Main Mission. Completing the Main Mission rewards substantial amounts of Event Victory Points.
-- Using any version of Seyetik, Luisa Kim, Sulu, or Innovators will provide a chance to gain bonus progress on the Main Mission.
-- When you fail to gain bonus progress on the Main Mission using featured crew or crew with matching event bonus traits, the bonus progress chance goes up slightly the next time you use such crew in a mission. If you score the bonus progress, the bonus chance amount goes back to its initial value. 
-- You earn Event Victory Points each time you complete a Specialist Mission or the Main Mission. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Seyetik, Luisa Kim, Sulu, Innovators
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Specialist Missions!

featured_crew.name: Eddington
featured_crew.flavor: Before defecting to the Maquis, Michael Eddington had aspirations of climbing the ranks of Starfleet and eventually served on Deep Space Nine.

action.name: Well, I Am Here To Make Friends

featured_crew.name: Luisa
featured_crew.flavor: Luisa participated in terraforming on the planet Velara III and called herself 'the gardener of Eden.'

action.name: Terraforming Makes You Feel Almost God-like

featured_crew.name: Sulu
featured_crew.flavor: Sulu enjoyed botany as a hobby, taking care of a carnivorous plant he called Gertrude.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Reyga
rewards.flavor: A brilliant Ferengi scientist, Doctor Reyga invented the metaphasic shield before his death.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Eddington
rewards.flavor: Before defecting to the Maquis, Michael Eddington had aspirations of climbing the ranks of Starfleet and eventually served on Deep Space Nine.

action.name: Well, I Am Here To Make Friends

rewards.name: Sulu
rewards.flavor: Sulu enjoyed botany as a hobby, taking care of a carnivorous plant he called Gertrude.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Sulu
rewards.flavor: Sulu enjoyed botany as a hobby, taking care of a carnivorous plant he called Gertrude.

rewards.name: Luisa
rewards.flavor: Luisa participated in terraforming on the planet Velara III and called herself 'the gardener of Eden.'

action.name: Terraforming Makes You Feel Almost God-like

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Flex the bounds of terraforming tech with the Borg.

potential_rewards.name: Borg Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Borg faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

goals.flavor: Profit off the world with the Ferengi Alliance.

potential_rewards.name: Ferengi Alliance Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Ferengi Alliance faction missions.

potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Maquis faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Thank you for answering our hails, Captain. We're on a newly established terraforming base on a Class D planet. We were just getting started when things rapidly began falling apart here. Damage first to our equipment, and now to our life support systems."

"Things aren't 'falling apart'. This is clearly sabotage! I'm well aware of the outrage over our accepting the Ferengi contract to terraform worlds for them. If they want to rent out homes on new worlds to desperate settlers, that's their business! We can't waste this chance!"

"Please try not to think ill of us, Captain. The Ferengi contract also opened the door to accessing top of the line terraforming equipment. What we learn and accomplish with them could revolutionize terraforming across the galaxy. So will you help us find out what's going on?"

"Thank you for answering our hails, Captain. We're on a newly established terraforming base on a Class D planet. We were just getting started when things rapidly began falling apart here. Damage first to our equipment, and now to our life support systems."

"Things aren't 'falling apart'. This is clearly sabotage! I'm well aware of the outrage over our accepting the Ferengi contract to terraform worlds for them. If they want to rent out homes on new worlds to desperate settlers, that's their business! We can't waste this chance!"

"Please try not to think ill of us, Captain. The Ferengi contract also opened the door to accessing top of the line terraforming equipment. What we learn and accomplish with them could revolutionize terraforming across the galaxy. So will you help us find out what's going on?"
